stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Reed
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] 7 years
[Place of Birth] Victoria
[Date of Birth] Oct 16
[Race] Draco
[Height] 172cm
[Infection Status] 
Originium crystals are distributed across the surface of her body, confirmed Infected by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Excellent
[Mobility] Excellent
[Physical Resilience] Standard
[Tactical Acumen] Excellent
[Combat Skill] Excellent
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Outstanding

Reed, identity unknown, records missing. As an Oripathy patient, Reed was escorted by Medic Operators following her rescue from ruins in the aftermath of a war in Victoria's County Hillock. Post-recovery from injuries unrelated to Oripathy, she demonstrated superb combat skills and powerful Originium Arts in a testing environment. Her onboarding is currently being reviewed.

Imaging tests reveal blurry outlines of this operator's internal organs, clouded with abnormal dark spots. Her circulatory system shows an abnormally high rate of Originium particulate matter, with other signs of Oripathy infection, we can confirm that the Operator is Infected. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 9%
Traces of Originium are visible on Ms. Reed's skin.

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.27u/L
Ms. Reed's condition is extremely serious, and her prognosis is not optimistic! Oripathy is rapidly eroding at her body, and the crystallization of her skin far exceeds normal values. Wh—What should I do...?
—Sussurro, Medic Operator

[Originium Arts Overview]
You call this fire? Listen, you can ask any other theorist or fire-based Caster. You can even ask that little imp, Ifrit... Yes, go ask Ifrit if something like this can be called fire.
Let me reiterate: combustion is nothing more than a reaction. We use Originium Arts to directly control the process of combustion. Whatever this is you've brought in—no, it's nothing alike.
Look at this diagram. Look carefully at the breakdown... the combustion phenomenon is only a side effect! In fact, this biological tissue spontaneously ignites because it cannot withstand such vigorous cellular activity, which depends on nothing of the flames themselves.
Simply put, in the first stage, all tissue she contacts is rapidly activated. In the second stage, said tissue uncontrollably metabolizes, and in the third stage, it explodes with enormous energy.
If you claim that all her Arts necessarily cause fire, then fine, give me another three months, and I might be able to figure out the underlying mechanism. However, let me state this clearly...
Her Arts are not based upon fire, but upon the manipulation of life itself.
—Lab notes from Skyfire, Caster Operator

[Precautions]
......
4. Unlike Skadi and Projekt Red, Reed works well in a team setting, enough to serve as a field commander. However, her repulsion towards communication is visceral, spontaneous, and subjective; therefore, in a daily life setting, communication with Reed requires a formal request and written permission.
......
6. Operators Bagpipe and Reed are not to make contact without designated supervision.
7. Temporarily halt Reed's involvement in supporting Originium research, and do whatever is necessary to meet needs in the medical aspect. The operability of artificial catalysis upon late-stage Oripathy patients must be re-examined to determine the source of said operation.
......

[Classified Log]
There's only one way. Don't let anyone else find her.
—Kal'tsit

[Selected Records]

'...Next, please turn to page 6 of the handout. I hope that everyone had an opportunity to preview the introduction last night.
The lions all claimed to be king, as the Dracos and Aslans each received equal opportunities. Under the terms of this ancient treaty, they were both qualified to become the sole monarch of Victoria. The Dracos symbolized unquenchable thirst for conquest, while the Aslans symbolized power through order. People believed that for countless generations, Victoria was influenced by three forces, including those two.
Let's not even talk about how many bloody uprisings have been caused by the succession of the throne... Ever since ancient times, people have known that Victoria is not a friendly country capable of handling its own affairs internally. The Aslans originated in Sargon, Leithanien, and even some other countries that have since been wiped out by Catastrophes. The Dracos, who were in power, had no reason to peacefully accept a group of outsiders, let alone allow them to rule their country.
The treaty that formed between the Aslans and Dracos could not have arisen in a stable and civilized environment. The most harrowing aspects of this history have been made light of, woven into a prologue for the legends that would follow. In this regard, the oral tradition preserved through gypsy bards and poets can be more reliable than 'official sources.'
However, there are always fragments of truth embedded within legends and tall tales.
Though a modern state, Victoria has paradoxically sustained its ancient tradition of rule. As early as two decades ago, the Draco bloodline was considered to have been severed, leaving none to threaten the Aslan's firm rule over Victoria.
What happened afterwards was covered in the second class session last month.

However, the status quo of Victoria is not the focus of this lecture. What I would like everyone to consider is this: 'Granted that the contract between the Dracos and Aslans was engraved somewhere even more conspicuous than the throne itself, what would happen if there was still a Draco alive out there that could challenge the Aslan rule?'
Nations that had been dissolved, ethnic groups which had been assimilated, civilizations that had been conquered... they all are waiting for a new banner.
However, one must still consider that depending on the nature of the leader, the ideology that takes root - and the subsequent strength of the movement that it grows into - can be quite different.

Nevertheless, I still wish to remind everyone that this so-called 'history' is happening around us right now, and the trajectory of the future may not be entirely determined by the origins of the ones who decided to set things into motion.
After all...
Hmm? Look at the time... that about concludes things for today's lecture. For next week's class, I'd like everyone to turn to page 14, and familiarize yourself with the life of a typical Draco king and see how his image in history differs from how it is presented in legend. Then, we will discuss the reasons for these differences.

You had a question, Miss Istina?
Ah, of course. History is the cause of current events. As for my personal interests...
When the Reunion Movement publicly announced its existence to a small number of political entities, most policymakers decided to respond to the threat of a show of power from the Infected with force; and a small number of them were so concerned that just the appearance of a Reunion leader would trigger an immediate response.
Combined with the fact that Rhodes Island has secretly received some new patients recently, I am looking forward to a day when these lions will no longer rear their heads. After two fulminating red dragons suddenly emerged from the heir of the lost Draco clans, Victoria may once again be cast into a storm of unrest.


Hmm, if the testimony is true... there might even be three.'

—Recording of Rhodes Island Lecture No. 43, History of the Empire, Lecturer Hypatia

'Hm? I don't recognize her. She doesn't recognize me either, right?'
Did you hope to find something we both hold in common? I'm afraid that's not going to work.
Dagda said she has some recollection? You should seek her out then.
Mm, sorry. When the time comes, I'll tell you everything I know, but now is not the time.
And no, I don't know anything about her.
No, I'm not offended. I have no issues with you asking me for advice.
......
Sorry, Doctor! Please wait.
Let me think about this a bit more, about why this young lady's so unwilling to disclose even the slightest bit of information. The truth might not be far from what I originally surmised.
First, she doesn't know if she should trust you, or the extent to which she should trust you. Just like me when I first joined Rhodes Island, I never would've placed my trust in a stranger.
And another reason, which I think is just as simple.
Perhaps telling you those things would bring about your death, whole and true.
Be careful.'

—Records of a conversation with Siege

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.

Ambience Synesthesia Tailor-Provided/Emerald Holiday. Reed's plain outfit during downtime. Lyrics have limits, and manuscripts have deadlines, but all that's still far, far away. They're no worry; in the comfort of the afternoon sun, finishing your glass of juice comes first.

skills.desc: ATK <@ba.vup>+{atk:0%}</>, each attack deals an additional <@ba.vup>{attack@skill.atk_scale:0%}</> ATK as Arts damage, and restores <@ba.vup>+1</> DP when defeating an enemy.

modules.desc:
Operator Reed has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude in preemptive penetration of the battlefield situation so as to secure leeway for deployment.
The Field Operations Department has thus passed the following resolution:
This operator shall be appointed a Vanguard Operator during field operations to exercise Charger responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

'Is this... a gift?'
Looking at the finely wrapped parcel before her, Reed is somewhat at a loss.
'The clean new outfit's standard, but I added a little material to give it quicker cooling ability... oh, yeah, the tactical gloves are heat-resistant too. Open it and try them on, time's a-wastin'... crap, am I spoiling the surprise? The Doctor's not gonna dock me for this, right?'
The Vampire engineer hastily covers her mouth, and tiptoes out of the special dormitories, winking at Reed before she shuts the door.
'Happy holidays!'
'Happy... holidays.'
Reed holds her parcel, fixed to the spot, unsure if her murmur succeeded in floating past the door.
For her, holidays are difficult to reconcile with happiness.
It was on the stroke of a holiday that her mother and father died. The gift they'd brought back from Londinium fell at her feet, wrapping stained with blood.
Her sister dragged her out of the snow, pulling her hand, passing through one alley after another. Candlelight shone on window after window, but nothing lay ahead of them at all.
With the footfall behind them drawing closer, her sister told her to hide, finding her the darkest corner to tuck herself in, her chest burning from not even daring to breathe.
'It's alright now, Loughshinny. Stand up.'
The voice of her sister returned to her side. She opened her eyes, saw the firelight creep out from a stranger's window, and it became a strange purple, and malevolent in its very look, scaring even the pitch-black night away.
Her legs were still too weak to stand. No more did her sister hold out a hand, but went back into the glow of the blaze. She knew that if she couldn't follow, then she would be forever left behind.
She grit her teeth and slowly rose up, pushing back the fear and pain, chasing the figure in the firelight. Without knowing it, she ran farther and farther, becoming too but a small shadow.
Ever since, the fire never truly went out. It burned within her eyes, inside her heart, the night of every festivity.
Five years on, her sister placed a spear in her hands.
In her recollections, this was her last time being given a holiday gift. Since then, the flames came to ignite at her spearpoint too.
Slowly, she became used to the heat, to the scorching that stabbed through her body with each breath. She believed this undying flame would be with her for life, even chasing her in death.
Until she received this present.
She realizes, and it startles her. So there were people who'd still try to put water to these raging flames.
In every test and training thereafter, Reed puts on these gloves, and after the battle, she'll attentively clean her spear's blade according to her manuals.
She hasn't told Closure that in actuality, there exists no reagent nor material that can cool a Draco's flames.
After all, when she touched this gift, she truly did feel a long-lost, refreshing chill.

missionList.desc: Defeat a total of 70 enemies with Reed (excluding Support Units)
Clear Main Theme 9-5 with a 3-star rating under Standard Environment; You must deploy your own Reed and cannot include any other Vanguard Operators as members

voice_lines.voiceText: Doctor, here is the paperwork. Is it strange to see me on clerical errands? The truth is, compared to battle, I much prefer... writing...

Doctor, look outside the window. The night is quiet... and peaceful. Up until now, every night has been filled with the red light of fire, and the stench of burning. I only feel easier... on nights like tonight.
There's been a—red-haired Vouivre girl, who never stops staring at me... Does she suspect my identity? But... she wouldn't have any evidence... Hm. I'm not going to let her find me out.
Is it time for my regular medical examination? Un... Understood. But... I don't trust those other doctors. If I have to be examined, I want... you to help me with it.
You all have a lot of questions, but I can't answer any of them. This is for your own sakes, and I encourage you ... not to overestimate yourselves.
...I am strong. I know the terrifying power I hold, though I... have no love for it. But if you desire it—then yes, I will fight...
This spear... I am not able to fully use its power. Despite that, I've had it take so many lives. Guilt? ...No, I have no guilt. After all, our lives are all equally worthless

I do not mind my Oripathy... Without it, I would never have spent my days here. It will take my life? I—still do not mind it... So many other things across this land could kill just the same, why then... would you fixated on this particular one?

I am a shadow, but I do not spurn that. I am only able to stay here, incognito, because I am a shadow... However... however... if someone with the same face as me ever finds you, do not fight her! You will die. I don't... I don't want you dead...
I will stand vigil for you, so... please rest at ease. Good night.
You were the ones... who saved me? You want my name? ...Just 'Reed' is fine... like the reeds by a pond. A nondescript existence...
Your battles are—very bitter... but, this way, many more may continue to live.
Forward, soldiers of Dublinn! ...I was constantly forced to give these words, but in reality—I hated them...
You have a dream that calms my soul... and I want to help you accomplish it. So long as I rouse the fires of Dublinn, they may come to light your way in the dark of night.
The fires of war will char the wilderness...
Just as you have exhorted me, I will no longer neglect the lives of others...
And so, we go to harvest...
Why do you burn as easily as stalks of wheat...?
My flames, they scorch...
No one else will see I am here, will they...?
Ah...
Only ashes will remain...
The living blaze will purify your tainted souls.
I am Dublinn.
I... am Dublinn!
Sister...
Endless battles, flames that never cease to smolder... This isn't what you truly desire, is it?
Should this fight be for the sake of our shared future, I will bear anything...
What else can we hope to gain from the battlefield? Let's go. Hurry, let's go home...
No. I won't let anyone hurt you... I swear it.
Can I have a separate room? I don't mind how small it may be...
Ah!
Doctor... won't my body temperature burn you?
Arknights.

Ah, you found me. Why am I not at the party? Well, if you could... sit by my side. Truthfully, watching the smiles on others' faces during the holidays still hurts my heart. It seems—this snow won't lift any time soon...
Doctor...? Um... it's nothing.
Doctor, happy birthday to you. Ah, please wait a moment. You can't blow this candle out. Just let it burn like this for a little while... I hope that this flame—can bring you some warmth.
By now, I've said all my thanks. I just hope that, when danger ultimately approaches, Rhodes Island won't be drawn in, or at the very least, it'll be in my power to protect you...

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to a Dormitory, self Morale recovered <@cc.vup>+0.7</> per hour
When this Operator is assigned to the Control Center, increases Morale of all Operators in the Control Center by <@cc.vup>+0.05</> per hour.
